verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; Behold, I will raise up against Babylon, and against them that dwell in the midst of them that rise up against me, a destroying wind;
verses.web: LORD says: “Behold, I will raise up against Babylon, and against those who dwell in Lebkamai, a destroying wind.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: "I am going to stir up a destroying wind against Babylon and against those who live there."

verses.kjv: And will send unto Babylon fanners, that shall fan her, and shall empty her land: for in the day of trouble they shall be against her round about.
verses.web: I will send to Babylon strangers, who will winnow her. They will empty her land; for in the day of trouble they will be against her all around.
verses.ct: "I will send foreigners to Babylon who will scatter her like chaff. They will empty her land, because on the day of disaster they will surround her on every side."

verses.kjv: Against him that bendeth let the archer bend his bow, and against him that lifteth himself up in his brigandine: and spare ye not her young men; destroy ye utterly all her host.
verses.web: Against him who bends, let the archer bend his bow, also against him who lifts himself up in his coat of mail. Don’t spare her young men! Utterly destroy all her army!
verses.ct: "Let the archers draw their bows against Babylon's archers! Attack the soldiers in their armor! Don't spare her young men — wipe out her entire army!"

verses.kjv: Thus the slain shall fall in the land of the Chaldeans, and they that are thrust through in her streets.
verses.web: They will fall down slain in the land of the Chaldeans, and thrust through in her streets.
verses.ct: Her people will fall dead in the land of the Chaldeans, cut down in her streets.

verses.kjv: For Israel hath not been forsaken, nor Judah of his God, of the LORD of hosts; though their land was filled with sin against the Holy One of Israel.
verses.web: For Israel is not forsaken, nor Judah, by his God, by LORD of Armies; though their land is full of guilt against the Holy One of Israel.
verses.ct: Israel and Judah have not been abandoned by their God, the LORD of Armies — even though their land was full of sin against the Holy One of Israel.

verses.kjv: Flee out of the midst of Babylon, and deliver every man his soul: be not cut off in her iniquity; for this is the time of the LORD’s vengeance; he will render unto her a recompence.
verses.web: “Flee out of the middle of Babylon! Everyone save his own life! Don’t be cut off in her iniquity; for it is the time of LORD’s vengeance. He will render to her a recompense.
verses.ct: "Run from Babylon! Save your lives, every one of you! Don't be destroyed because of her sin, because this is the time of the LORD's vengeance. He is paying her back for what she has done."

verses.kjv: Babylon hath been a golden cup in the LORD’s hand, that made all the earth drunken: the nations have drunken of her wine; therefore the nations are mad.
verses.web: Babylon has been a golden cup in LORD’s hand, who made all the earth drunk. The nations have drunk of her wine; therefore the nations have gone mad.
verses.ct: Babylon was like a golden cup in the LORD's hand, making the whole earth drunk. The nations drank her wine, and it drove them mad.

verses.kjv: Babylon is suddenly fallen and destroyed: howl for her; take balm for her pain, if so be she may be healed.
verses.web: Babylon has suddenly fallen and been destroyed! Wail for her! Take balm for her pain. Perhaps she may be healed.
verses.ct: Suddenly Babylon has fallen and been shattered! Weep for her! Bring medicine for her wounds — maybe she can still be healed.

verses.kjv: We would have healed Babylon, but she is not healed: forsake her, and let us go every one into his own country: for her judgment reacheth unto heaven, and is lifted up even to the skies.
verses.web: “We would have healed Babylon, but she is not healed. Forsake her, and let’s each go into his own country; for her judgment reaches to heaven, and is lifted up even to the skies.
verses.ct: "We tried to heal Babylon, but she couldn't be healed. Leave her behind, and let each of us return to our own country. Her judgment reaches up to the heavens — it towers to the skies."

verses.kjv: The LORD hath brought forth our righteousness: come, and let us declare in Zion the work of the LORD our God.
verses.web: ‘LORD has produced our righteousness: come, and let’s declare in Zion the work of LORD our God.’
verses.ct: "The LORD has vindicated us! Come, let's tell everyone in Zion what the LORD our God has done."

verses.kjv: Make bright the arrows; gather the shields: the LORD hath raised up the spirit of the kings of the Medes: for his device is against Babylon, to destroy it; because it is the vengeance of the LORD, the vengeance of his temple.
verses.web: “Make the arrows sharp! Hold the shields firmly! LORD has stirred up the spirit of the kings of the Medes, because his purpose is against Babylon, to destroy it; for it is the vengeance of LORD, the vengeance of his temple.
verses.ct: "Sharpen the arrows! Grab the shields! The LORD has stirred up the kings of the Medes, because his plan is to destroy Babylon. This is the LORD's vengeance — vengeance for his temple."

verses.kjv: Set up the standard upon the walls of Babylon, make the watch strong, set up the watchmen, prepare the ambushes: for the LORD hath both devised and done that which he spake against the inhabitants of Babylon.
verses.web: Set up a standard against the walls of Babylon! Make the watch strong! Set the watchmen, and prepare the ambushes; for LORD has both purposed and done that which he spoke concerning the inhabitants of Babylon.
verses.ct: "Raise the battle flag against Babylon's walls! Strengthen the guard! Post the watchmen! Set your ambushes! The LORD has both planned and carried out everything he declared against the people of Babylon."

verses.kjv: O thou that dwellest upon many waters, abundant in treasures, thine end is come, and the measure of thy covetousness.
verses.web: You who dwell on many waters, abundant in treasures, your end has come, the measure of your covetousness.
verses.ct: Babylon, you sit beside many waters, overflowing with treasure — but your end has come. The thread of your greed has been measured and cut.

verses.kjv: The LORD of hosts hath sworn by himself, saying, Surely I will fill thee with men, as with caterpillers; and they shall lift up a shout against thee.
verses.web: LORD of Armies has sworn by himself, saying, ‘Surely I will fill you with men, as with the canker worm; and they will lift up a shout against you.’
verses.ct: The LORD of Armies has sworn by himself: "I will fill you with enemy soldiers as thick as swarming locusts, and they will raise a victory shout against you."

verses.kjv: He hath made the earth by his power, he hath established the world by his wisdom, and hath stretched out the heaven by his understanding.
verses.web: “He has made the earth by his power. He has established the world by his wisdom. By his understanding he has stretched out the heavens.
verses.ct: He made the earth by his power. He established the world by his wisdom. He stretched out the heavens by his understanding.

verses.kjv: When he uttereth his voice, there is a multitude of waters in the heavens; and he causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth: he maketh lightnings with rain, and bringeth forth the wind out of his treasures.
verses.web: When he utters his voice, there is a roar of waters in the heavens, and he causes the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth. He makes lightning for the rain, and brings the wind out of his treasuries.
verses.ct: When he speaks, the waters in the heavens roar. He draws up clouds from the ends of the earth. He sends lightning with the rain and releases the wind from his storehouses.

verses.kjv: Every man is brutish by his knowledge; every founder is confounded by the graven image: for his molten image is falsehood, and there is no breath in them.
verses.web: “Every man has become brutish without knowledge. Every goldsmith is disappointed by his image; for his molten image is falsehood, and there is no breath in them.
verses.ct: Everyone who makes idols is senseless and ignorant. Every metalworker is put to shame by his carved images, because his cast idols are frauds — there is no breath in them.

verses.kjv: They are vanity, the work of errors: in the time of their visitation they shall perish.
verses.web: They are vanity, a work of delusion. In the time of their visitation, they will perish.
verses.ct: They are worthless, the product of deception. When the time of judgment comes, they will be destroyed.

verses.kjv: The portion of Jacob is not like them; for he is the former of all things: and Israel is the rod of his inheritance: the LORD of hosts is his name.
verses.web: The portion of Jacob is not like these, for he is the former of all things; including the tribe of his inheritance: LORD of Armies is his name.
verses.ct: But the God of Jacob is nothing like these idols — he is the one who formed everything, including Israel, the people who are his inheritance. His name is the LORD of Armies.

verses.kjv: Thou art my battle axe and weapons of war: for with thee will I break in pieces the nations, and with thee will I destroy kingdoms;
verses.web: “You are my battle ax and weapons of war. With you I will break the nations into pieces. With you I will destroy kingdoms.
verses.ct: "You are my war club, my weapon of battle. With you I will shatter nations. With you I will bring down kingdoms."

verses.kjv: And with thee will I break in pieces the horse and his rider; and with thee will I break in pieces the chariot and his rider;
verses.web: With you I will break in pieces the horse and his rider.
verses.ct: "With you I will shatter the horse and its rider. With you I will shatter the chariot and its driver."

verses.kjv: With thee also will I break in pieces man and woman; and with thee will I break in pieces old and young; and with thee will I break in pieces the young man and the maid;
verses.web: With you I will break in pieces the chariot and him who rides therein. With you I will break in pieces man and woman. With you I will break in pieces the old man and the youth. With you I will break in pieces the young man and the virgin.
verses.ct: "With you I will shatter men and women. With you I will shatter the old and the young. With you I will shatter young men and young women."

verses.kjv: I will also break in pieces with thee the shepherd and his flock; and with thee will I break in pieces the husbandman and his yoke of oxen; and with thee will I break in pieces captains and rulers.
verses.web: With you I will break in pieces the shepherd and his flock. With you I will break in pieces the farmer and his yoke. With you I will break in pieces governors and deputies.
verses.ct: "With you I will shatter the shepherd and his flock. With you I will shatter the farmer and his oxen. With you I will shatter governors and officials."

verses.kjv: And I will render unto Babylon and to all the inhabitants of Chaldea all their evil that they have done in Zion in your sight, saith the LORD.
verses.web: “I will render to Babylon and to all the inhabitants of Chaldea all their evil that they have done in Zion in your sight,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "But I will repay Babylon and all who live in Chaldea for every evil thing they did to Zion — right before your eyes," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Behold, I am against thee, O destroying mountain, saith the LORD, which destroyest all the earth: and I will stretch out mine hand upon thee, and roll thee down from the rocks, and will make thee a burnt mountain.
verses.web: “Behold, I am against you, destroying mountain,” says LORD, “which destroys all the earth. I will stretch out my hand on you, roll you down from the rocks, and will make you a burned mountain.
verses.ct: "I am against you, you mountain of destruction," declares the LORD, "you who destroy the whole earth. I will stretch out my hand against you, roll you off the cliffs, and turn you into a scorched mountain."

verses.kjv: And they shall not take of thee a stone for a corner, nor a stone for foundations; but thou shalt be desolate for ever, saith the LORD.
verses.web: They won’t take a cornerstone from you, nor a stone for foundations; but you will be desolate forever,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "No one will take a cornerstone or a foundation stone from you, because you will lie in ruins forever," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Set ye up a standard in the land, blow the trumpet among the nations, prepare the nations against her, call together against her the kingdoms of Ararat, Minni, and Ashchenaz; appoint a captain against her; cause the horses to come up as the rough caterpillers.
verses.web: “Set up a standard in the land! Blow the trumpet among the nations! Prepare the nations against her! Call together against her the kingdoms of Ararat, Minni, and Ashkenaz! Appoint a marshal against her! Cause the horses to come up as the rough canker worm!
verses.ct: "Raise a battle flag throughout the land! Sound the trumpet among the nations! Prepare the nations for war against her! Summon the kingdoms of Ararat, Minni, and Ashchenaz against her! Appoint a commander against her! Send horses charging in like swarms of locusts!"

verses.kjv: Prepare against her the nations with the kings of the Medes, the captains thereof, and all the rulers thereof, and all the land of his dominion.
verses.web: Prepare against her the nations, the kings of the Medes, its governors, and all its deputies, and all the land of their dominion!
verses.ct: "Prepare the nations for battle against her — the kings of the Medes, their governors, all their officials, and every territory they control!"

verses.kjv: And the land shall tremble and sorrow: for every purpose of the LORD shall be performed against Babylon, to make the land of Babylon a desolation without an inhabitant.
verses.web: The land trembles and is in pain; for the purposes of LORD against Babylon stand, to make the land of Babylon a desolation, without inhabitant.
verses.ct: The land trembles and writhes in agony, because every one of the LORD's plans against Babylon will be carried out — to turn the land of Babylon into an empty wasteland with no one living in it.

verses.kjv: The mighty men of Babylon have forborn to fight, they have remained in their holds: their might hath failed; they became as women: they have burned her dwellingplaces; her bars are broken.
verses.web: The mighty men of Babylon have stopped fighting, they remain in their strongholds. Their might has failed. They have become as women. Her dwelling places are set on fire. Her bars are broken.
verses.ct: Babylon's warriors have stopped fighting. They stay huddled in their fortresses. Their strength has drained away — they've become as helpless as women. Her buildings are set on fire. The bars on her gates are smashed.

verses.kjv: One post shall run to meet another, and one messenger to meet another, to shew the king of Babylon that his city is taken at one end,
verses.web: One runner will run to meet another, and one messenger to meet another, to show the king of Babylon that his city is taken on every quarter.
verses.ct: Runner after runner races to the king, messenger after messenger arrives, all reporting that the city has been captured from every side.

verses.kjv: And that the passages are stopped, and the reeds they have burned with fire, and the men of war are affrighted.
verses.web: So the passages are seized. They have burned the reeds with fire. The men of war are frightened.”
verses.ct: The river crossings have been seized, the marshes set ablaze, and the soldiers are paralyzed with fear.

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; The daughter of Babylon is like a threshingfloor, it is time to thresh her: yet a little while, and the time of her harvest shall come.
verses.web: For LORD of Armies, the God of Israel says: “The daughter of Babylon is like a threshing floor at the time when it is trodden. Yet a little while, and the time of harvest comes for her.”
verses.ct: The LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says: "Babylon is like a threshing floor at harvest time — the moment to thresh her has come. Very soon, her time of reaping will arrive."

verses.kjv: Nebuchadrezzar the king of Babylon hath devoured me, he hath crushed me, he hath made me an empty vessel, he hath swallowed me up like a dragon, he hath filled his belly with my delicates, he hath cast me out.
verses.web: “Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon has devoured me. He has crushed me. He has made me an empty vessel. He has, like a monster, swallowed me up. He has filled his mouth with my delicacies. He has cast me out.
verses.ct: "Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon devoured me and crushed me. He left me like an empty jar. Like a monster, he swallowed me whole, filling his stomach with my finest things, then spit me out."

verses.kjv: The violence done to me and to my flesh be upon Babylon, shall the inhabitant of Zion say; and my blood upon the inhabitants of Chaldea, shall Jerusalem say.
verses.web: May the violence done to me and to my flesh be on Babylon!” the inhabitant of Zion will say; and, “May my blood be on the inhabitants of Chaldea!” will Jerusalem say.
verses.ct: The people of Zion will say, "May the violence done to us and our people fall on Babylon!" And Jerusalem will say, "May our blood be on the heads of those who live in Chaldea!"

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD; Behold, I will plead thy cause, and take vengeance for thee; and I will dry up her sea, and make her springs dry.
verses.web: Therefore LORD says: “Behold, I will plead your cause, and take vengeance for you. I will dry up her sea, and make her fountain dry.
verses.ct: So the LORD says: "I will take up your case and get justice for you. I will dry up Babylon's river and drain her springs."

verses.kjv: And Babylon shall become heaps, a dwellingplace for dragons, an astonishment, and an hissing, without an inhabitant.
verses.web: Babylon will become heaps, a dwelling place for jackals, an astonishment, and a hissing, without inhabitant.
verses.ct: "Babylon will become a heap of rubble, a den for jackals — an object of horror and mockery, with no one living there."

verses.kjv: They shall roar together like lions: they shall yell as lions’ whelps.
verses.web: They will roar together like young lions. They will growl as lions’ cubs.
verses.ct: "Her people roar together like young lions; they growl like lion cubs."

verses.kjv: In their heat I will make their feasts, and I will make them drunken, that they may rejoice, and sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake, saith the LORD.
verses.web: When they are heated, I will make their feast, and I will make them drunk, that they may rejoice, and sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake up,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "While they are flushed with excitement, I will prepare a feast for them. I will make them so drunk that they celebrate wildly — then fall into an eternal sleep and never wake up," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter, like rams with he goats.
verses.web: “I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter, like rams with male goats.
verses.ct: "I will lead them down to slaughter like lambs, like rams and goats."

verses.kjv: How is Sheshach taken! and how is the praise of the whole earth surprised! how is Babylon become an astonishment among the nations!
verses.web: “How Sheshach is taken! How the praise of the whole earth seized! How Babylon has become a desolation among the nations!
verses.ct: "How Sheshach has been captured! The city praised by the whole earth has been seized! What a horror Babylon has become among the nations!"

verses.kjv: The sea is come up upon Babylon: she is covered with the multitude of the waves thereof.
verses.web: The sea has come up on Babylon. She is covered with the multitude of its waves.
verses.ct: "The sea has risen over Babylon; she is buried under its crashing waves."

verses.kjv: Her cities are a desolation, a dry land, and a wilderness, a land wherein no man dwelleth, neither doth any son of man pass thereby.
verses.web: Her cities have become a desolation, a dry land, and a desert, a land in which no man dwells. No son of man passes by it.
verses.ct: "Her cities have become wastelands — dry, barren desert where no one lives and no one even passes through."

verses.kjv: And I will punish Bel in Babylon, and I will bring forth out of his mouth that which he hath swallowed up: and the nations shall not flow together any more unto him: yea, the wall of Babylon shall fall.
verses.web: I will execute judgment on Bel in Babylon, and I will bring out of his mouth that which he has swallowed up. The nations will not flow any more to him. Yes, the wall of Babylon will fall.
verses.ct: "I will punish Bel in Babylon and force him to spit out what he swallowed. Nations will no longer stream to him. Even the wall of Babylon will fall."

verses.kjv: My people, go ye out of the midst of her, and deliver ye every man his soul from the fierce anger of the LORD.
verses.web: “My people, go away from the middle of her, and each of you save yourselves from LORD’s fierce anger.
verses.ct: "My people, get out of Babylon! Run for your lives from the fierce anger of the LORD!"

verses.kjv: And lest your heart faint, and ye fear for the rumour that shall be heard in the land; a rumour shall both come one year, and after that in another year shall come a rumour, and violence in the land, ruler against ruler.
verses.web: Don’t let your heart faint. Don’t fear for the news that will be heard in the land. For news will come one year, and after that in another year news will come, and violence in the land, ruler against ruler.
verses.ct: "Don't lose heart, and don't be afraid when rumors sweep through the land. One rumor will come one year, and another the next — rumors of violence in the land, of ruler fighting against ruler."

verses.kjv: Therefore, behold, the days come, that I will do judgment upon the graven images of Babylon: and her whole land shall be confounded, and all her slain shall fall in the midst of her.
verses.web: Therefore behold, the days come that I will execute judgment on the engraved images of Babylon; and her whole land will be confounded. All her slain will fall in the middle of her.
verses.ct: "The days are surely coming when I will punish Babylon's carved idols. Her whole land will be put to shame, and all her dead will lie scattered within her."

verses.kjv: Then the heaven and the earth, and all that is therein, shall sing for Babylon: for the spoilers shall come unto her from the north, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Then the heavens and the earth, and all that is therein, will sing for joy over Babylon; for the destroyers will come to her from the north,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "Then the heavens and the earth and everything in them will shout for joy over Babylon, because the destroyers will come against her from the north," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: As Babylon hath caused the slain of Israel to fall, so at Babylon shall fall the slain of all the earth.
verses.web: “As Babylon has caused the slain of Israel to fall, so the slain of all the land will fall at Babylon.
verses.ct: "Just as Babylon caused the people of Israel to fall, so the people of the whole earth will fall at Babylon."

verses.kjv: Ye that have escaped the sword, go away, stand not still: remember the LORD afar off, and let Jerusalem come into your mind.
verses.web: You who have escaped the sword, go! Don’t stand still! Remember LORD from afar, and let Jerusalem come into your mind.”
verses.ct: "You who survived the sword, go! Don't just stand there! Remember the LORD even though you are far away, and keep Jerusalem in your thoughts."

verses.kjv: We are confounded, because we have heard reproach: shame hath covered our faces: for strangers are come into the sanctuaries of the LORD’s house.
verses.web: “We are confounded, because we have heard reproach. Confusion has covered our faces, for strangers have come into the sanctuaries of LORD’s house.”
verses.ct: "We are ashamed because we have heard insults. Disgrace covers our faces, because foreigners have entered the holy places of the LORD's house."

verses.kjv: Wherefore, behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will do judgment upon her graven images: and through all her land the wounded shall groan.
verses.web: “Therefore behold, the days come,” says LORD, “that I will execute judgment on her engraved images; and through all her land the wounded will groan.
verses.ct: "The days are coming," declares the LORD, "when I will punish her carved idols, and throughout her land the wounded will groan in agony."

verses.kjv: Though Babylon should mount up to heaven, and though she should fortify the height of her strength, yet from me shall spoilers come unto her, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Though Babylon should mount up to the sky, and though she should fortify the height of her strength, yet destroyers will come to her from me,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "Even if Babylon could climb up to the heavens and fortify her strongholds at impossible heights, I would still send destroyers against her," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: A sound of a cry cometh from Babylon, and great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans:
verses.web: “The sound of a cry comes from Babylon, and of great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans!
verses.ct: "Listen! A cry of anguish rises from Babylon — the sound of massive destruction from the land of the Chaldeans!"

verses.kjv: Because the LORD hath spoiled Babylon, and destroyed out of her the great voice; when her waves do roar like great waters, a noise of their voice is uttered:
verses.web: For LORD lays Babylon waste, and destroys out of her the great voice! Their waves roar like many waters. The noise of their voice is uttered.
verses.ct: "The LORD is destroying Babylon and silencing her loud voice. Her enemies surge in like roaring waves, like the thunder of mighty waters."

verses.kjv: Because the spoiler is come upon her, even upon Babylon, and her mighty men are taken, every one of their bows is broken: for the LORD God of recompences shall surely requite.
verses.web: For the destroyer has come on her, even on Babylon. Her mighty men are taken. Their bows are broken in pieces, for LORD is a God of retribution. He will surely repay.
verses.ct: A destroyer has come against Babylon. Her warriors are captured. Their bows are snapped in pieces, because the LORD is a God of justice — he always pays back in full.

verses.kjv: And I will make drunk her princes, and her wise men, her captains, and her rulers, and her mighty men: and they shall sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake, saith the King, whose name is the LORD of hosts.
verses.web: I will make her princes, her wise men, her governors, her deputies, and her mighty men drunk. They will sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake up,” says the King, whose name is LORD of Armies.
verses.ct: "I will make her officials, wise men, governors, commanders, and warriors drunk. They will fall into an eternal sleep and never wake up," says the King, whose name is the LORD of Armies.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts; The broad walls of Babylon shall be utterly broken, and her high gates shall be burned with fire; and the people shall labour in vain, and the folk in the fire, and they shall be weary.
verses.web: LORD of Armies says: “The wide walls of Babylon will be utterly overthrown. Her high gates will be burned with fire. The peoples will labor for vanity, and the nations for the fire; and they will be weary.”
verses.ct: The LORD of Armies says: "Babylon's thick walls will be completely demolished, and her towering gates will be burned to the ground. The nations have exhausted themselves for nothing — all their labor will go up in flames."

verses.kjv: The word which Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah the son of Neriah, the son of Maaseiah, when he went with Zedekiah the king of Judah into Babylon in the fourth year of his reign. And this Seraiah was a quiet prince.
verses.web: The word which Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah the son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, when he went with Zedekiah the king of Judah to Babylon in the fourth year of his reign. Now Seraiah was chief quartermaster.
verses.ct: This is the message that the prophet Jeremiah gave to Seraiah son of Neriah, son of Maaseiah, when Seraiah traveled to Babylon with King Zedekiah of Judah in the 4th year of Zedekiah's reign. Seraiah served as the chief quartermaster.

verses.kjv: So Jeremiah wrote in a book all the evil that should come upon Babylon, even all these words that are written against Babylon.
verses.web: Jeremiah wrote in a book all the evil that should come on Babylon, even all these words that are written concerning Babylon.
verses.ct: Jeremiah had written on a scroll all the disasters that would come upon Babylon — everything recorded in these prophecies against her.

verses.kjv: And Jeremiah said to Seraiah, When thou comest to Babylon, and shalt see, and shalt read all these words;
verses.web: Jeremiah said to Seraiah, “When you come to Babylon, then see that you read all these words,
verses.ct: Jeremiah told Seraiah, "When you arrive in Babylon, make sure you read all these words aloud."

verses.kjv: Then shalt thou say, O LORD, thou hast spoken against this place, to cut it off, that none shall remain in it, neither man nor beast, but that it shall be desolate for ever.
verses.web: and say, ‘LORD, you have spoken concerning this place, to cut it off, that no one will dwell in it, neither man nor animal, but that it will be desolate forever.’
verses.ct: "Then pray, 'LORD, you have declared that this place will be destroyed so that no one will live in it — neither people nor animals — and that it will be desolate forever.'"

verses.kjv: And it shall be, when thou hast made an end of reading this book, that thou shalt bind a stone to it, and cast it into the midst of Euphrates:
verses.web: It will be, when you have finished reading this book, that you shall bind a stone to it, and cast it into the middle of the Euphrates.
verses.ct: "When you finish reading this scroll, tie a stone to it and throw it into the middle of the Euphrates River."

verses.kjv: And thou shalt say, Thus shall Babylon sink, and shall not rise from the evil that I will bring upon her: and they shall be weary. Thus far are the words of Jeremiah.
verses.web: Then you shall say, ‘Thus will Babylon sink, and will not rise again because of the evil that I will bring on her; and they will be weary.’ ” Thus far are the words of Jeremiah.
verses.ct: "Then say, 'This is how Babylon will sink and never rise again, because of the disaster I am bringing on her. Her people will collapse from exhaustion.'" This concludes the words of Jeremiah.
